definition: variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: Twelve enemy transport aircraft on the handstand were knocked out by mortar shells.
sentences.chinese: 停机坪上的十二架敌方运输机被迫击炮弹击毁了。

sentences.english: Their houses were endamaged by the enemy's shellfire.
sentences.chinese: 他们的房屋被敌人炮火击毁了。

sentences.english: And he shall set engines of war and battering rams against thy walls, and shall destroy thy towers with his arms.
sentences.chinese: 支起破城机撞击你的城墙，用铁器击毁你的角楼。

sentences.english: Impacts by high-velocity projectiles do not always destroy the tank and its crew.
sentences.chinese: 高速弹体的冲击并不总能击毁坦克和消灭乘员。

sentences.english: The German Panthers destroyed many Shermans in this battle.
sentences.chinese: 德军的豹式坦克在战斗中击毁了很多谢尔曼坦克。

sentences.english: Their houses were damaged by the enemy's shellfire.
sentences.chinese: 他们的房屋被敌人的炮火击毁。

sentences.english: Space to destroy buildings on the road to block the monsters.
sentences.chinese: 空格键可以击毁路上的建造物来拦阻怪物一段时间。

sentences.english: Three Covenant destroyers detonated under this combined fire.
sentences.chinese: 圣约人的驱逐舰纷纷被这样的组合炮火击毁。

sentences.english: First, they knocked out an M3 halftrack at the rear of the British column.
sentences.chinese: 他们首先击毁了英军车队后方的一辆M3装甲车。

definition: to blow up/to destroy with explosives
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
